channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chinese and European Leaders Meet Amid Grievances on Trade
item.description: European Union officials are attending a summit in Beijing with China’s top leaders. China’s support of Russia and a long list of trade disputes are o...

item.title: How a Chinese Border Town Keeps Russia’s Economy Afloat
item.description: The flow of goods in Manzhouli, China’s main border crossing with Russia, underscores increasingly close ties between the two countries, complicating ...

item.title: The World Is Letting Gaza Starve
item.description: Today, many children in Gaza are so hungry they may never recover, and our supplies are critically low.

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla will start adding vehicles it doesn’t directly own into its robotaxi network next year
item.description: The Austin-based EV company is still working on taking safety drivers out of the passenger seats and expanding into new cities.

item.title: Elon Musk wants more control of Tesla so activist investors can’t boot him—but not so much the board can’t fire him if he goes ‘crazy’
item.description: He said his ownership stake is "a major concern," noting he hoped the Tesla board addresses the issue at its annual shareholder meeting in November.

item.title: Trump to Visit Federal Reserve As Campaign Against Powell Intensifies
item.description: The administration has repeatedly criticized Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the central bank, for his handling of the economy and the cost of renovati...

item.title: Bondi Told Trump His Name Appeared in Epstein Files
item.description: It was not clear what those documents were, or in what context the president’s name was raised.

item.title: Thursday Briefing: Your Russia Questions Answered
item.description: Plus, meet the other great Kurosawa.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Are Exploiting Flaws in Widely Used Software, Microsoft Says
item.description: The company said state-backed hacking groups were breaching systems through flaws in SharePoint, which is used by the U.S. government and companies ar...

item.title: Thai and Cambodian Troops Fire at Each Other as Relations Implode
item.description: Soldiers traded fire over a disputed border after weeks of diplomatic tension between the Southeast Asian nations.

item.title: Why One of the Causes of Falling Birthrates May Be Prosperity
item.description: Economic growth has the unintended side effects of making parenthood more difficult and expensive.

item.title: Silicon Valley’s elite descend on D.C. to celebrate Trump’s AI Action Plan in a surreal fusion of podcast and policy

item.title: Tesla misses Wall Street expectations on revenue, earnings per share in second quarter earnings
item.description: Wall Street analysts had entered the earnings season with low expectations for Tesla. It underachieved.

item.title: The CEO of Southeast Asia’s largest bank knows even her job is at risk from AI
item.description: “If I can be replaced by AI, so can everything else!”
